question_text: Why are Blu-ray discs able to store more data than CDs and DVDs?
answer_options: They use larger bumps for better reflectivity
They use a shorter wavelength laser allowing tighter track spacing
They are thicker and more durable
correct_answer: They use a shorter wavelength laser allowing tighter track spacing
explanation: Blu-ray uses a blue-violet laser (~405 nm) vs. the red laser used in CDs/DVDs, allowing more data to be packed per square millimeter.
